      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity parent)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        setParent in class EntityImpl

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(Entity entity)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Adds a new children entity.
        This does not update the parent of the given entity.

        Note: You should not need to call this method, instead use EntityImpl.setParent(Entity).

        Specified by:
        addEntity in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        addEntity in class NetworkDeviceDefault

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity(Entity entity)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Search for the given children entity and removes it.
        This does not update the parent property of the entity.

        Note: You should not need to call this method, instead use EntityImpl.setParent(Entity) with null parameter.

        Specified by:
        removeEntity in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        removeEntity in class NetworkDeviceDefault

      • isRoutingEnabled

        public boolean isRoutingEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: NetworkDevice
        Returns true if this device can route data received from one interface to another interface.

        This flag is used by RoutingProtocols when looking for routes.

        Specified by:
        isRoutingEnabled in interface NetworkDevice
        Returns:
        true if this device can route data

      • supportsFailureStateUpdate

        public boolean supportsFailureStateUpdate()
        Description copied from interface: FailureProneEntity
        Returns true if the FailureProneEntity.FailureState of this entity can be modified. Note that even if a entity implements the FailureProneEntity interface, it does not mean it supports state changing.
        Thus you have to check the return value of this method to ensure that you can use FailureProneEntity.setFailureState(FailureState) safely.

        If this method returns false and you try to change the FailureProneEntity.FailureState of this entity you will get a UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        supportsFailureStateUpdate in interface FailureProneEntity
        Overrides:
        supportsFailureStateUpdate in class FailureProneEntityImpl
        Returns:
        true if the FailureProneEntity.FailureState of this entity can be modified

      • getVirtualMachine

        public ThinClientVirtualMachine getVirtualMachine()
        Description copied from interface: ThinClient
        Returns the main virtual machine of this ThinClient.

        The returned virtual machine should be running. and you should not stop it or remove it from its parent.

        Specified by:
        getVirtualMachine in interface ThinClient
        Returns:
        main virtual machine of this ThinClient
